THINGS TO DO
IN MILLBANK

Exciting news!! We will now be featuring an informative video titled WHO ARE THE AMISH. It will be playing everyday we are open from 10am-8pm (spring to fall). It is about 50 minutes and will be played on a continuous loop. It will help give you a look into the life of our amish friends! Please share with your friends! It will be located in a shed to the left of our building.

There are many FUN & UNIQUE things to do on your visit to Millbank! Please enjoy your stay in our village ðŸ™‚

Millbank Cheese Factory

Millbankcheese@cyg.net

Tel: 519 595 8787 Fax: 519 595 4907

  • Great cheese from cow, sheep & goat milk. Organic & Artisan cheese
  • Fresh Curd & Diary Products
  • Honey, James, Preserves & Giftware
  • Beautiful Cheese Trays & Gift Baskets

“Fair Trade Foods”

Visit this unique cheese outlet and taste a variety of Canada’s best cheddars and speciality cheeses.

Following the fine cheese making tradition since 1908.

Millbank Cheese & Cold Storage Inc. is owned by over 90 local families, the majority of whom are small scale traditional farm families.

 

THE ORANGE BARN

Seasonal
“Our fruit is always fresh. If it’s picked on a Monday, we’ll have it by the end of the week. It’s picked when it’s ripe and it’s usually bigger, juicier and better tasting. It’s not artificially coloured … and we inspect it carefully; we replace anything that’s spoiled. We’ve also dealt with the same packing houses for most of our 25 years, mostly in Florida and sometimes California … and know that certain areas have better fruit. We offer it at a good price, too.”

KISSING BRIDGE TRAILWAY

The Kissing Bridge Trailway travels for 45 km through rural communities, rivers and wetlands of southern Ontario along a former railway (Behind Anna Mae’s!).Â The trail surface is stone chip for much of the trailway. The trail is largely flat and even and is well-suited for a number of uses:

  • Hiking
  • Running
  • Cycling
  • Cross-country skiing
  • Snowshoeing
  • Snowmobiling (in permitted sections)

No motorized vehicles or horses.

Amish School Sale

Every year (3rd Saturday in July I believe)

  • Quilts
  • Furniture
  • Horses & Pets
  • Machinery
  • Homemade Goodies
  • Household Items, Crafts, etc.

Huge & interesting auction sale with 6-8 rings selling at once!

Address:

Held at the farm of Alvin and Wanda Ebersol
#4917 Line 67 RR 1 Milvert, ON
N0K1M0
(3 miles north-west of Milverton)

If you’re interested in seeing the Amish, many of them have stores that you can visit on your own. Please take note that these stores will not be open on Sundays.
